abstract: Russian businessmen say their meetings at World Economic Forum in Davos have been almost entirely with Chinese, Indian and Middle East partners or possible investors; it is stark demonstration of how sanctions imposed over war in Ukraine have hurt Russia's contacts with Europe and United States.
lead_paragraph: Russian businessmen said privately that their meetings this year were almost exclusively with Chinese, Indian and Middle East partners or potential investors.
snippet: Russian businessmen said privately that their meetings this year were almost exclusively with Chinese, Indian and Middle East partners or potential investors.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

headline.main: Snubbed by U.S. and Europe, Kremlin Looks to Asia at Davos
headline.print_headline: Snubbed by U.S. and Europe, Kremlin Looks to Asia for New Business Partnerships
